body.p: The IASB noted that the transition requirements as proposed in the 2020 Exposure Draft to apply the amendments retrospectively in accordance with IAS 8—including the requirement to reinstate particular discontinued hedging relationships—would be subject to impracticability applying IAS 8. However, the IASB agreed with respondents’ concerns that there could be other circumstances in which it would not be impracticable to reinstate the hedging relationship, but such reinstatement would be challenging or would have limited benefit. For example, if the hedging instrument or hedged item has been designated in a new hedging relationship, it appears inappropriate to require entities to reinstate the ‘old’ (original) hedging relationship and discontinue or unwind the ‘new’ (valid) hedging relationship. Consequently, the IASB added paragraph 7.2.44(b) to IFRS 9 to address these concerns.
